mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, Zachary Taylor to Mrs. E[leanor] P[arke Custis] Lewis, 1849 April 12
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Taylor, Zachary, 1784-1850
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Zachary Taylor writes from Washington City [D. C.] to Eleanor Parke Custis Lewis in Audley, Virginia. Assures her he would like to comply with her wishes [as regards political appointments], but he is swamped with applications, and his predecessor [Polk] filled all offices just before his term was up--will try to aid Col. Lee's son [G.W. Custis Lee?] get West Point appointment--explains system of choosing. Autograph letter signed, 3 pages, envelope franked by Z. Taylor, postmarked "Washington DC 16 Apr, Free," red seal blurred, watermark (H & O).
